column1: People: Person H; Person J; Person K </s> THE Bennets were engaged to dine with the Lucases
column2: and again during the chief of the day
column3: was Miss Lucas so kind as to listen to Person H. </s> Person J took an opportunity of thanking her.  "It keeps him in good humour
column4: said she, and I am more obliged to you than I can express." </s> Person K assured her friend of her satisfaction in being useful
column5: and that it amply repaid her for the little sacrifice of her time. This was very amiable
column6: but Person K's kindness extended farther than Person J had any conception of; -- its object was nothing less than to secure her from any return of Person H's addresses
column7: by engaging them towards herself. Such was Miss Lucas's scheme; and appearances were so favourable that when they parted at night
column8: she would have felt almost sure of success if he had not been to leave Hertfordshire so very soon. </s> But here
column9: she did injustice to the fire and independence of his character
column10: for it led him to escape out of Longbourn House the next morning with admirable slyness
column11: and hasten to Lucas Lodge to throw himself at her feet. </s> He was anxious to avoid the notice of his cousins
column12: from a conviction that if they saw him depart
column13: they could not fail to conjecture his design
column14: and he was not willing to have the attempt known till its success could be known likewise; for though feeling almost secure
column15: and with reason
column16: for Person K had been tolerably encouraging
column17: he was comparatively diffident since the adventure of Wednesday. </s> His reception however was of the most flattering kind. </s> Miss Lucas perceived him from an upper window as he walked towards the house
column18: and instantly set out to meet him accidentally in the lane. </s> But little had she dared to hope that so much love and eloquence awaited her there. </s> In as short a time as Person H's long speeches would allow
column19: every thing was settled between them to the satisfaction of both; and as they entered the house
